entry.title: MVC Version of LiteBlog
entry.content: This is the MVC version of LiteBlog. The WebForms version used AjaxControlToolkit extensively. The MVC version uses jQuery extensively. FckEditor continues to be the RichEdit editor. Future releases of LiteBlog will be MVC based.

entry.title: New features added to the blog
entry.content:
A lot of new features are added to the blog:

  1. Scheduled publishing
  2. Ability to add code in the blog from the editor
  3. Syntax Highlighter to highlight the code
  4. Enhanced XML Profile Provider to delete inactive user profiles
  5. A better compose page

A few technical enhancements have been made:

  1. Usage of FckEditor as the compose tool
  2. Extensive use of AjaxControlToolkit
  3. Good reusable code in the business/data layer
  4. DIV based styling of UI

I hope the new release is much more useful than the previous one. Get started with the admin portal. User: Admin, Password: admin.

entry.title: Introduction to LiteBlog BlogEngine
entry.content:
LiteBlog is a light weight blog engine designed to help integrate a blog into your existing .Net website. To get started, you can do the following steps:

  • Login to the Admin portal using username: Admin, password: admin
  • Change the username to your name. Login back and change password.
  • Compose posts using the Compose link

The entire source code of the blog is available for your use. You can extend it and use it as you wish. Some of the features of the blog include:

  • Entire blog is stored as XML (including user profiles and membership)
  • Native XML support
  • Composing documents using RichEdit controls
  • Uploading documents and images
  • Comments moderation
  • Labeling or Category management
  • Archive management
  • Good use of AJAX features
  • Good publishing features
  • Extensive use of application caching
  • XML Layer is abstracted as good interface

Thanks for checking out LiteBlog.
